questions.question_text: What must you be prepared for when you see this traffic sign with a 10% indication?

options.a: The brakes may become less efficient with prolonged use on the downhill slope
options.b: You should shift into neutral to save fuel
options.c: Braking distance is shorter on the downhill slope

questions.explanation: According to the danger signs section, on a steep downhill slope (indicated by percentage), braking distance increases and brakes may become less efficient if used prolongedly.
questions.image_prompt: Style: Clear driving manual illustration. Content: A triangular red warning sign with a black car on a slope pointing downwards and the text '10%' inside.

questions.question_text: What must you avoid when driving past roadworks marked by a 'Loose Stones' danger sign?

options.b: Sudden movements of the steering wheel

questions.explanation: When encountering loose stones or gravel, you must avoid sudden movements of the steering wheel and avoid braking heavily to prevent skidding.
questions.image_prompt: Style: Clear driving manual illustration. Content: A triangular red warning sign showing a car profile with gravel/stones flying up from the rear wheel.

questions.question_text: You see a triangular sign with a windsock symbol. What action should you take?

options.a: Accelerate to cut through the wind resistance
options.b: Steer slightly in the same direction as the wind
options.c: Reduce speed and be prepared to countersteer

questions.explanation: This sign indicates side winds. The correct conduct is to reduce speed and be prepared to countersteer to maintain your lane.
questions.image_prompt: Style: Clear driving manual illustration. Content: A triangular red warning sign with a black windsock symbol inside.

questions.question_text: At a STOP sign, where exactly must you stop?

options.a: Only if there is oncoming traffic visible
options.b: At the stopline and, if necessary, stop again at the sight line
options.c: Slowly rolling past the line to see clearly

questions.explanation: The rule requires stopping at the stopline. If visibility is poor, you must stop again at a point where you can see along the intersecting road (the sight line).
questions.image_prompt: Style: Realistic driver's view (Right-hand drive). Scene: Approaching an intersection with a solid white line across the left lane and an octagonal red STOP sign on the left.

questions.question_text: What does a blue circular sign with a red border and a red cross (X) indicate?

options.a: No parking, but stopping for less than 3 minutes is allowed

questions.explanation: A blue circle with a red rim and a red cross indicates 'No stopping'. You may not stop at all (unless forced by traffic conditions).
questions.image_prompt: Style: Clear driving manual illustration. Content: A circular regulatory sign with a blue background, red border, and a red 'X' cross over it.

questions.question_text: When you see the 'School Bus' sign (yellow/green), what is the primary requirement?

options.b: Sound your horn to warn the children
options.c: Reduce your speed and be ready to brake

questions.explanation: This sign warns of school buses and children. Drivers must reduce speed and be fully prepared to brake for children crossing.
questions.image_prompt: Style: Clear driving manual illustration. Content: A square sign (often yellow or green backing) showing a symbol of two children, or a bus symbol with text 'School Bus'.

questions.question_text: You see a solid white line in the centre of the roadway. What does this signify?

options.a: You may cross it to overtake if the road is clear
options.b: You may not cross or straddle the line
options.c: It indicates the edge of the carriageway

questions.explanation: A continuous (solid) white line in the center of the road prohibits crossing or straddling the line for overtaking.
questions.image_prompt: Style: Realistic driver's view (Right-hand drive). Scene: Driving on a tarmac road. In the center of the road, there is a distinct solid white line separating the lanes.

questions.question_text: What does this 5,5t traffic sign indicate?

options.a: The actual mass of the vehicle

questions.explanation: When the value is shown on a circular sign with only 5,5 t, it often refers to the actual mass limit for safety reasons (e.g., bridges). Note: The book distinguishes between signs for permissible total mass and actual mass.
questions.image_prompt: Style: Clear driving manual illustration. Content: A circular regulatory sign with a red border, a black truck symbol, and the text '5,5t' inside.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of a square blue sign with a white arrow pointing up and a red arrow pointing down?

options.a: You must give way to oncoming traffic
options.b: You have precedence (priority) over oncoming traffic

questions.explanation: This sign indicates that you have the right of way over vehicles approaching from the opposite direction at a narrow point.
questions.image_prompt: Style: Clear driving manual illustration. Content: A square blue sign with a large white arrow pointing up and a smaller red arrow pointing down.

questions.question_text: What does a green square sign with '55 km/h' and a traffic light symbol indicate?

options.b: Coordinated traffic lights (green wave) if driving at 55 km/h
options.c: Traffic lights ahead change every 55 seconds

questions.explanation: This sign indicates a 'green wave' system. If you maintain the average speed shown (55 km/h), you should reach the next traffic lights when they are green.
questions.image_prompt: Style: Clear driving manual illustration. Content: A green square sign displaying a traffic light signal symbol and the text '55 km/h'.

questions.question_text: What does a circular sign with a red border and the notation '2m' between two horizontal arrows indicate?

options.a: Prohibition for vehicles wider than 2m including load

questions.explanation: This is a width restriction sign. It prohibits entry for any vehicle whose width, including its load, exceeds the indicated measurement.
questions.image_prompt: Style: Clear driving manual illustration. Content: A circular regulatory sign with a red border. Inside is the text '2m' flanked by black arrows pointing inwards horizontally.

questions.question_text: You encounter a sign with three red diagonal stripes on a white background. What does this warn of?

options.a: A level crossing approximately 240 m ahead
options.b: A level crossing approximately 100 m ahead

questions.explanation: These marker beacons count down to a level crossing. Three stripes typically indicate a distance of approximately 240m (80m per stripe).
questions.image_prompt: Style: Clear driving manual illustration. Content: A vertical white rectangle beacon with three diagonal red stripes.

questions.question_text: When waiting at a closed level crossing barrier for a long time, what should you do to protect the environment?

options.b: Keep the engine idling to maintain battery charge
options.c: Rev the engine occasionally to warn others

questions.explanation: To save fuel and reduce air pollution, you should switch off your engine when waiting for a long time, such as at closed level crossing barriers.
questions.image_prompt: Style: Realistic driver's view (Right-hand drive). Scene: Waiting behind a lowered railway barrier. The dashboard is visible.

questions.question_text: What does a blue square sign showing a white 'T' shape with a red bar at the top indicate?

options.b: A T-junction where you have priority

questions.explanation: This sign indicates a cul-de-sac or dead-end road, meaning there is no exit at the other end for vehicles.
questions.image_prompt: Style: Clear driving manual illustration. Content: A blue square sign with a white vertical line capped by a red horizontal bar (resembling a T).

questions.question_text: What does a sign showing a white arrow curving to the left on a blue background imply?

options.b: The road bends to the left
options.c: You must pass the obstacle on the left

questions.explanation: A blue circle with a white arrow pointing diagonally down to the left indicates that you must pass the obstacle (such as a traffic island) on the left side.
questions.image_prompt: Style: Clear driving manual illustration. Content: A circular blue sign with a white arrow pointing diagonally downwards to the left.
